ext_descriptions.ext_description: the label by which the address is known.
the identifier that distinguishes the organization.
the label by which the organization is known.
the text that characterizes the organization.
the label by which the organization_relationship is known.
the text that characterizes the organization_relationship.
the label by which the organization_role is known.
the text that characterizes the organization_role.
the text that characterizes the organizational_address.

An organization_type is a recognized kind of organization.
A national standards body is a type of organization.
the identifier that distinguishes the organization_type.
the label by which the organization_type is known.
the text that characterizes the organization_type.
An organization_type_relationship relates two instances of the organization_type entity data type and provides for the identification, naming, and description of that relationship.
the text that characterizes the organization_type_relationship.
the identifier that distinguishes the organization_type_relationship.
the label by which the organization_type_relationship is known.

related_organization_type: the other instance of organization_type that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, attribute shall be the dependent one.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

one of the instances of organization_type that is a part of the relationship.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
the label by which the organizational_project is known.
the text that characterizes the organizational_project.
the identifier that distinguishes the organizational_project.
the label by which the organizational_project_relationship is known.
the text that characterizes the organizational_project_relationship.
the identifier that distinguishes the person.
the label by which the person_and_organization is known.
the text that characterizes the person_and_organization.
the label by which the person_and_organization_role is known.
the text that characterizes the person_and_organization_role.
the identifier that distinguishes the person_type.
the label by which the person_type is known.
the text that characterizes the person_type.

A person_type_definition is a characterization of type of person.
A driver could be defined as someone who holds a valid driving licence.
the identifier that distinguishes the person_type_definition.
the label by which the person_type_definition is known.
the word or words that characterize the person_type_definition.
the person_type_definition_formation to which the person_type_definition relates.

A person_type_definition_formation is a collector of definitions of a type of person.
A driver could be defined as someone who holds a valid driving licence or as someone who is employed as a driver.
the identifier that distinguishes the person_type_definition_formation.
the label by which the person_type_definition_formation is known
the text that characterizes the person_type_definition_formation.
the person_type to which the person_type_definition_formation belongs.
A person_type_definition_relationship relates two instances of the person_type_definition entity data type and provides for the identification, naming, and description of that relationship.
the identifier that distinguishes the person_type_definition_relationship.
the label by which the person_type_definition_relationship is known.
the text that characterizes the person_type_definition_relationship.

the other instance of person_type_definition that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, attribute shall be the dependent one.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

one of the instances of person_type_definition that is a part of the relationship.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
the label by which the person_role is known.
the text that characterizes the person_role.
the text that characterizes the personal_address.

A position_in_organization is a specific function or job performed by a person in a particular organization. It is defined by responsibilities and activities. A position that is not fulfilled by a person is a vacancy.
The chairperson of SC4.
the identifier that distinguishes the position_in_organization.
the label by which the position_in_organization is known.
the text that characterizes the position_in_organization.

A position_in_organization_type is a generic function or job that is performed in organizations.
Company director.
the identifier that distinguishes the position_in_organization.
the label by which the position_in_organization is known.
the text that characterizes the position_in_organization.
A position_in_organization_relationship relates two instances of the position_in_organization entity data type and provides for the identification, naming, and description of that relationship.
the identifier that distinguishes the position_in_organization_relationship.
the label by which the position_in_organization_relationship is known.
the text that characterizes the position_in_organization_relationship.

the other instance of position_in_organization that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, attribute shall be the dependent one.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

one of the instances of position_in_organization that is a part of the relationship.
The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
